title: Ward jumping should be removed
body:
Nobody should have access to this mechanic, wards should be used mainly for vision.
Lee Sin making dumb decisions and then getting over a wall without getting punished is just unfair.
Give Jax a rework cause he is in a bad spot anyway.

replies.body: Crying Lee mains in 3...2...1...

Its a dying mechanic, slowly being taken out of the game, as seen with how they removed it from katarina, there was a long talk about this a long time ago with reguards to lee sin, and the result was that he didnt receive any of the w perks, ie shield and that other thing that comes with it when he would hop to wards which I think would be a somewhat fair compromise.

It's a dying mechanic that isn't dying fast enough. They should have stripped ward hopping from the remaining two and a half (not sure if Elise is still able to E to enemy wards) champs when they reworked Kat and killed the mechanic in one fell swoop, but God forbid Lee gets an ouchy on his overloaded kit.
Elise can but I mean...she has to have vision of that ward, and unless you have something like a control ward giving vision of it, that window is incredibly small
Regardless, it still shouldn't be possible.

Except it isn't a ward hop, it is closer to how ekko can E > Jump to a ward as part of his attack.  Enemy wards are enemy units and Elise can jump to enemy units which does make sense when you consider that it is an AA without the damage.
I still stand by my point - it shouldn't be possible to jump or dash to wards.

It shouldn't be possible to do so to allied wards. I see little problem with doing so to enemy wards, as that is you making well on the enemies decision, not purely added mobility based only upon your own.

I think it makes sense to get rid of both. Lee and Jax can jump to their own wards because they can jump to all allied units. So getting rid of it would mean moving wards out of what the game defines as a "unit". So whichever side it's on, the ward would not be a "unit" anymore. But a separate entity that can only be AA'd to death.
dont see a problem with essentially auto attacking an enemy ward. only problem with the ward hops is that you're jumping to your own untargetable object.
you mean Jhin mains who think a 54% pickrate and a 52% winrate together are somehow okay?

Wards cost money when Lee Sin was introduced to the game.  Ward hoping was designed to be a big play with big risk.  The introduction of free ward items was a huge buff to Lee Sin that's never been addressed.

Make him only able to ward hop to Control Wards.  Make him spend 75g every time he wants to ward hop.  It still allows the "LCS BIG PLAYZ" but stops people from spamming wards and jumping everywhere.
i actually like this. that's a fair point. although most Lee's back then built sightstone as one of their items before trackers included two wards.

Your post by far explains the biggest issue with Lee Sin now. That bonus part of his kit was balanced around it costing him gold to gain an extra option in his kit. The cost restriction no longer exists and Riot needs to address it.
This is actually a pretty solid point.

In practice, ward jumping has always been a method of turning a unit-targeted dash into a free-targeted dash. If Lee or Jax somehow really need unrestricted mobility, then their dashes should just be made free-targeted on their own, and if they don't, they shouldn't, but in either case that shouldn't have to rely on popping down a vision item and exploiting the game's old unit targeting system, which is clunky and especially opaque to newer players.

The only issue with this is that Jax and Lee have the benefit of being able to not miss.
You click, you land there.

Being free targeted is different from being able to ward hop, since you CAN run out of wards if you are actually providing vision.

They are just slightly more restricted than they otherwise would be, is what i am getting at.

That's true, ward-hopping does carry slightly more of a cost, but even early on, that's not especially imposing when compared to the situations in which a ward-hop becomes critical to winning or surviving, e.g. a gank or an escape. Providing vision also isn't the main point of the ward-hop, which is part of why the mechanic isn't that great (you're using a purely non-combat item in the middle of combat for some completely unrelated purpose). If Lee or Jax are intended by the devs to have free-targeted mobility at a much higher cost, then it could still be possible to implement that with a separate cooldown, as with LeBlanc's global clone ult.

My personal opinion on this is that neither Lee nor Jax truly need free-targeted mobility: Jax needs a rework anyway, as he hasn't aged well and suffers from many classic skirmisher issues (he's one-note, and either steamrolls or fails to do anything useful depending on how fed he is); Lee depends on his ward-hopping for his Insec kick, which has become iconic on him, but already has access to such a wealth of tools, and has such a high skill floor, that he really shouldn't be able to perfectly dictate the pace of fights, on top of having more options than anyone else in the middle of combat, nor does he need yet another "high skill mechanic" when simply trying to memorize all of his abilities for the first time can be challenging. Really, the only reason he hasn't lost that ability, which Riot themselves had tried to enact a while back, is because his fanbase has grown so attached to every part of his kit that removing any component will always feel like pulling teeth.

question: what's the reason

He is so binary, he functions like riven (go in, stun, get out) but all of his abilities are binary point and click or one button presses. He is about as close to a stat check a champion can be. If he is strong, then he has very little counterplay options, whereas if riven or fiora is strong most of their damage is avoidable

Lee's removes skill expression from his kit. He has 3 potential ways to disengage including W, and the majority of its use is making Q more reliable, which is where half of Lee's recent issues come from. 

Jax's is fine design-wise, and realistically just needs some relatively light work to start functioning again, not a rework.

__________

Why do people have it in their heads that a "champion underperforming->needs rework"?
jax may not really need anything more than adding some ad ratios to his abilities. But what he really needs is a visual rework since hes visually comparable to lulu and old heimer.

Visually, **definitely** needs some work. You're right.
_____________
Ratios would be a bad area to buff him, tbh.

All he needs is 10-25% bonus armor/mr pen passive somewhere.

He already functions vs squishies like he should; the problem is that tanks invalidate him because he has no way to bypass them, itemization or otherwise.

This is why he's always too strong or too weak in any given meta. He either snowballs well and doesn't fall off, or has to work within the 20-30 minute window after TF or TF/gunblade and close out the game before anyone gets significant resists.

My biggest problem with Lee ward jump is that it is a free flash. Normally he should use his Q, and if he misses (because you outplayed him), he should be useless. But no, he jumps near you and use q from zero distance. So much about skillshots and outplays. The escape is just an extra.

It has nothing to do with fairness, its just a dumb ability.

If Riot actually added more champions that could ward jump it would be a perfectly fair mechanic, but it would still be a dumb nonsense ability to have.

It makes no sense for most abilities to be able to jump to wards. Look at Jax, his ward jump is an ability that is supposed to be offensive in nature, jumping on an enemy and hitting them, so why can he jump on a ward or even his allies? Look at Lee Sin, his ward jump is a ability to come to the aid of allies, so why would/can he jump to a ward?

I have no doubt that when these kinds of champions eventually get reworded, they'll get their silly ward jumping removed and replaced with properly functioning abilities that make sense. You can already see it happen when Braum got released, he didn't have a ward jump even though his ability is no different from Lee Sin's. They probably aren't removing existing ward jumps just yet because it would fuck too much with the kit and power balance of the champions.

At least, I hope they'll remove this nonsense eventually.

I feel like this is the best way i can phrase my thoughts: I think wards should only be able to be "engaged" with if that engagement would deal damage IE Ekko E blink or Elise repel. If it wouldnt deplete a health chunk, then it shouldnt work.
